title: Rafael Pineiro, First Deputy Police Commissioner, to Retire
title_page: Rafael Pineiro, First Deputy Police Commissioner, to Retire - The New York Times
maintext:
Rafael Pineiro, the New York Police Department’s second-highest-ranking official, will retire at the end of October, officials said on Monday.
Mr. Pineiro, a 44-year police veteran and the department’s highest-ranking Hispanic, had been considered a top candidate for police commissioner last year before Mayor Bill de Blasio named William J. Bratton.
The reason for Mr. Pineiro’s departure was not immediately clear, and the department’s top spokesman would not elaborate. Mr. Pineiro, the first deputy commissioner, declined to comment.
One high-ranking Police Department official, who spoke only on the condition of anonymity, suggested the departure was not voluntary, saying Mr. Pineiro, 65, was in shock. “He was forced out,” the official said, adding that Mr. Pineiro had been told it was part of Mr. Bratton’s overhaul of the department.
